title: Standard Form
text: The standard form is made up of a binomial term that is squared, and a constant added or subtracted outside of the parentheses.

title: Finding Binomial
text: The binomial expanded should match up with the $$x^2$$ and $$x$$ terms of the equation, and the constant can be dealt with later.

title: Constant in Parentheses
text: What constant is added or subtracted from the $$x$$ in the binomial term? It should be $$\frac{1}{2}$$ the coefficient of the $$x$$ term.

title: Binomial Expansion
text: Once the binomial is expanded, an extra constant is added from the $${\left(-6\right)}^2$$. Subtract the constant to keep the equation the same.

title: Resulting Constant
text: What is the resulting constant when the $$32$$ is added to the $$-36$$ used to offset the term added when we expand the binomial?
